official-title.#text:
To amend title 10, United States Code, to provide appropriate recognition for the survivors of
			 members of the Armed Forces who die while serving on certain active or
			 reserve duty, to expand the availability of the Gold Star Installation
			 Access Card for survivors of deceased members of the Armed Forces, and to
			 extend commissary store and exchange store and other MWR retail facility
			 benefits to the parents of such members.

to expedite the ability
			 of a Gold Star family member to gain unescorted access to military
			 installations for the purpose of obtaining the on-base services and
			 benefits for which the Gold Star family member is entitled or eligible.

text.#text: The Secretary of each military department and the

The Secretaries concerned shall work jointly to ensure that a Gold Star Installation Access Card
			 issued to a Gold Star family member by one Armed Force is accepted for
			 access to military installations of another Armed Force.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may take such measures as the

text.#text: In developing, issuing, and accepting the Gold Star Installation Access Card, the
to prevent fraud in the procurement or use of the Gold Star Installation Access Card;

to limit installation access to those areas that provide the services and benefits for which the
			 Gold Star family member is entitled or eligible; and

to ensure that the availability and use of the Gold Star Installation Access Card does not
			 adversely affect military installation security.

Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretaries concerned
			 shall complete implementation of this section.
